name: ndmg (BIDS app)
command-line: mkdir -p OUTPUT_DIR1; if [ ! z PARTICIPANT_DIR]; then mv -a PARTICIPANT_DIR/* OUTPUT_DIR1/; fi; ndmg_bids BIDS_DIR OUTPUT_DIR1 ANALYSIS_LEVEL PARTICIPANT_LABEL SESSION_LABEL DATASET ATLAS MINIMAL HEMISPHERES LOG DEBUG

inputs.name: BIDS directory
inputs.description: The directory with the input dataset formatted according to the BIDS standard.

inputs.name: Output directory name
inputs.description: The directory will be created, where the output files would be saved.

inputs.name: Analysis level
inputs.description: Level of the analysis that will be performed. Multiple participant level analyses can be run independently (in parallel).

inputs.name: Directory with previously computed participant level result (Mandatory for group analysis)
inputs.description: The directory containing the output of the participants level analysis is required If you are running a GROUP level analysis, use another option.

inputs.name: Participant labels
inputs.description: The label(s) of the participant(s) that should be analyzed. The label corresponds to sub-<participant_label> from the BIDS spec (so it does not include "sub-"). If this parameter is not provided all subjects will be analyzed. Multiple participants can be specified with a space separated list.

inputs.name: Session labels
inputs.description: The label(s) of the session(s) that should be analyzed. The label corresponds to ses-<session_label>, an extension of the BIDS spec (so it does not include "ses-"). If this parameter is not provided all sessions will be analyzed. Multiple sessions can be specified with a space separated list.

inputs.name: Dataset
inputs.description: The name of the dataset you are perfoming QC on.

inputs.name: Minimal
inputs.description: Determines whether to show a minimal or full set of plots.

inputs.name: Hemispheres
inputs.description: Whether or not to break degrees into hemispheres or not.

inputs.name: Atlas
inputs.description: The atlas being analyzed in QC (if you only want one).

inputs.name: Debug
inputs.description: flag to store temp files along the path of processing.

output-files.name: Output directory
output-files.description: The directory where the output files should be stored.

output-files.name: Derivatives and output directory
output-files.description: The directory where the output files should be stored. If you are running a group level analysis, use another options.

groups.name: Derivative directories
groups.description: For a group analysis, a directory that already contains the output of participant-level analyses must be selected.

groups.name: Label
groups.description: Using specific sessions or participants (for session or participant analysis levels).
